Cz-VfCz0R-iNsK-7W5Yocw.text: This is a new location, their second (the first is just south of Dear Valley Airport).  And this was my first visit to either location.  It was very clean, as it should be being brand new.  The brisket was excellent. Good quality meat, nice deep smoke ring, good crust. They were out of pork (how could that be?) so I had a sausage link which was nothing special. The potato salad was quite good. The beans were not up to the quality you get at Honey Bear's, but OK.  On the sign they listed Coke products for fountain drinks, but the fountain actually had Kalil products (RC Cola, for example).  I will go back, if only to find out if the pork is any good.

O5xFk6UuMv1r4yF5gXEgXw.text: OMG! I was craving BBQ and googled BBQ near me... Pork On A Fork popped up, and I was shocked I never seen this place before.... But! That pulled pork sammich I had yesterday was DELICIOUS!!!! Now I have to try the ribs that I am most certainly sure are amazing as well ! Trust I will be back today. #MarkMyWords :) Good job everyone there! Let me add, you will be kept happy while in line. They are cheerful and just happy to be of assistance ! They welcome your upbeat, energized spirits to the fullest ! Thank you again for such great service.

QDFFd7ud434xLesMX3ryCg.text: I never try any place that's less than 5 stars on Yelp unless it's been highly recommended. But I came across Pork on a Fork through Uber Eats. It was good enough to order twice! Get the baked beans, macaroni and cheese, and cornbread as sides...trust me. Must warn everyone though, this is a heavy meal that's flavorful. If you're looking for a healthy option this is NOT the place. This is more of a cheat meal packed high in proteins AND bad fats...delicious nonetheless.

nr-KQ6-ylufKmqlVS-1yng.text: Simple meat options plopped onto a metal tray .. but deliciously cut and seasoned, with lots of different house sauces.

nNtkOgUTXgahmCpUKUYEIA.text: Stopped in for an early dinner. It wasn't at all crowded. But still a nice vibe to the place. The guy preparing meals behind the counter was very nice and patient with us newbies. I had a brisket bowl - never thought to have BBQ that way. It was really good. The brisket was very tender and juicy with a bit of crust on the edges. Lots of choices for toppings/additions. My husband had a pulled pork sandwich. He thought the pork was a little fatty for his taste, but once he got rid of some of the fat he thought it was very good. And their Cole slaw is near perfect in my book - creamy with a just right sweet/tangy flavor. Another great place to eat in our new neighborhood.

I6S15lahR3Wj5lbhaIAJQw.text: This is my first visit to this new location! Awesome atmosphere! Very clean, as well! The staff is very friendly and will help if you have any questions or need a hand to get everything to your table! The food is fabulous! I generally get the pulled pork &/or the sausage with a side of mac & cheese &/or beans! This is a great place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KiuhTg60lA5U9vrqYjopIg.text: Excellent BBQ. I got the sampler and the meats were tender and moist, especially the brisket. Sweet & Mild sauce was my favorite of the sauces. Mac & Cheese was particularly good too. This place is comparable to the authentic Texas BBQ I'm used to and I will definitely be back. Employee Ashley was very friendly and helpful in explaining the menu and helping me decide what to try.

81QVBLA_OxBxKHkeUB2tRA.text: The service was pretty terrible, employees made it feel like it was an inconvenience that they had to get food for a to go order. When I requested for waffle fries the young girl sighed and asked another employee if they had enough for me to order them. Portions were skimpy for the price you pay. The food was good quality, pretty standard for BBQ expectations. Overall, it's worth a try once but I'm not sure if i will be returning.

HrLBCTnELj5ncJXW41PqHA.text: Tasty new BBQ choice close to home.   Been for lunch a couple of times, the Big Boy Sampler is my favorite (chicken, pork, brisket, sausage).  Meat was flavorful and well prepared.  Good selection of BBQ sauces and beers.   The brisket is particularly tasty.   Tried a few sides, like the cornbread muffin, mac & cheese, and sweet potato fries.   Recommended.

zwUD2q0OnTfrc03u8jPbZg.text: Someone else used the words "salt bomb" in their review - that sums it up perfectly!  I was in on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch. I wanted to get a feel for the offerings, so I decided to order the two meat and two sides platter. I requested pork and brisket (they were out of pork, so I switched to chicken) as the meats, and the potato salad and beans for the sides. The employees behind the counter were great. Friendly, able to answer questions, and in good moods. The place is kept clean, and given the "off" time I visited, plenty of table space to choose from. The meats are served without sauce - and there are four sauces on the table to choose from. (Mild, sweet, mustard based, and hot.) The potato salad was nice. Maybe a little heavy on the red onion - but I happen to like onion, so I didn't mind. The beans were bland, and somehow, the pork in the beans was completely dry and tough. I can't figure out how that's possible - as there's so much liquid in the beans - any meat in there should positively be tender. Then comes the salt bomb! The chicken was so salty, I could barely taste any of the sauces other than the hot, which tasted like a BBQ salt lick. Tasting it without the sauce, I could barely discern any chicken OR smoke, only salt. The brisket (also seen in another review) was almost like a beef jerky. It was so dry and tough - and when tasting without the sauce - I could taste the meat and smoke - but mostly - no surprise here - salt! In the time it took me to eat the potato salad, half the beans and half the meat, I went through three cups of iced tea, and filled my cup a fourth time on my way out - and was still thirsty). I ended up throwing away over half the meat and leaving still hungry - I just can't handle all that salt. There are several options for decent BBQ in the area - I won't be coming back here at all.

SnPNxIzTfqZ5DkAqDjS6Ag.text: Food is decent, but nothing special. I do like their sauces, though, and appreciate that they are already on the table.

hUPm-ZuyScBL0Zq083c3pg.text: Avoid at all costs until management gets it right...my first time I chalked up to working the kinks out because it was their first week; I give it a few more weeks and it was worse...  For starters the menu is deceiving and doesn't contain enough info to explain what each thing comes with. The service line is disorganized and quite gross - mixing of utensils, dirty service, prep area, and poor temperature control - food borne illness waiting to happen. Upon ordering a brisket sandwich the employee thought it was acceptable to put pieces of nothing but fat in basket to weigh as part of order. When I called him on it, he removed fat out and proceeded to do it again with the end part/trash part of brisket.  People in line behind me were as astounded as I was. After that, I cancelled order and left.   Eat there at your own risk!

rrPXd_Q_CSNOGSlrD35_ww.text: We LOVE this place !!!!  Best barbecue in the valley !!!!  May have a little higher prices than other barbecue places, but it is well worth it !!!  Give it a try !!! My husband keep going back and it never leaves us disappointed !!!!

F60ZytSji-gCYEYP-5X9Kg.text: Best BBQ place I've been to in town.  Great sauces and huge portions.  Check this place out!!!

_BhhABmVrZEUUvXT00366Q.text: I ordered takeout from Pork on a Fork thru Grub Hub. The delivery time took almost 90 minutes.  I realize this is most likely the GH drivers fault.  But the food was nothing spectacular, I ordered a 4 meat sampler, with beans and potato salad. The sampler comes with pulled pork, brisket, pulled chicken, and a small piece of hot link. It was all in a ball wrapped in foil and all mixed together so it all tasted the same.  It should be kept separate so one can enjoy the flavors of each individual meat. The baked beans were killer, and the potato salad was ok.

_eiOID3lfnA8cTI_-JYk-w.text: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars but the staff are very absent minded and/or bad at service. Ordered the food corn bread wasn't ready but would be another 8 min. No big deal the staff was super nice and offered a side of coleslaw just because. My wife ordered a side salad and they said they would make it and bring it right out. 5 min later no salad I go up and ask for the salad was told "someone is making it". 5 min later still "making it" Well 15 min later he cornbread comes out and still no salad I ask the cook where the side salad and then the cook was surprised cause no one asked him to make a side salad. Two min later salad came. A lot of wilted lettuce and huge pieces of lettuce that my wife had to tear herself. Food was alright but I won't be going out of my way to go to this place again.

01Oag_r14fORCsWCMf5iyw.text: Food was excellent and service was even better! Mac & cheese was amazing. Got the pulled pork bowl and loved it. My boyfriend got a burrito and enjoyed his just as much. So happy to have a tasty BBQ restaurant in our area!

zitf4pyKcwHehKkw54hzNA.text: Yummy! Even though their name is pork on a fork (the pork is amazing!) I love love love their brisket, it's super tender and has a great smoke flavor, I love that they leave the sauce on the side, it honestly doesn't need it. If you're torn between sides, try the baked beans!

NuvuBBUURsLsvlexR1LhFw.text: I got food by carry out. Great pulled pork and sausages!  Will be a repeat customer. A must try

FPRw5ExeJO8rmfFEau2Uzw.text: I have eaten here 3 times now (2 dine in and 1 UberEATS). Each time they were out of something that we wanted. The first 2 times they were out of cornbread. The bbq is ok in flavor but dry. This is ok because they have sauce but you would expect a bbq joint to have very juicy meat. The worst experience was when we used UberEATS. We asked for extra sauce one of each kind because they have 4. We didn't receive any sauce at all. We called Uber who called the restaurant which said they only give 1 cup of sauce even though we didnt get any. For this reason I recommend avoiding using delivery or going elsewhere if you want juicy bbq.

Uq4McE158yMVtFLyEJK5nQ.text: If you want good barbecue without a lot of frills this is your place. Go to the counter order and for a good price you get barbecue that makes you want to plan your next visit. The place is small but ample. Lady was yelling at him to hurry up (not sure why I was the only one in line) then came over and started telling him off. He tried to ask her a question she told him to shut up. idAEduxI4XOF3b3-1QeBkQ.text: It wasn't awful but it wasn't great. I originally ordered the shredded pork but as the girl starting putting it on the plate I realized how much fat was on it so I swapped it to the brisket. Since that's what my boyfriend ordered and that's what looked better. The brisket appeared to LOOK less fatty. I also got the beans and corn bread as the side. As for my boyfriend he chose corn bread and sweet potato fries as his sides. The brisket was externally fatty. To the point where I had to actually spit it out mid chew. There was no actually good piece of meat on either of ours. The flavor was good though. The beans were the best thing but you can't ever go wrong with beans. Corn bread was old and dry. Or just over baked. My boyfriend didn't get his fries since non were prepared it took 10-15 minutes to get his fries which we were both done eating by that time. By the reviews I have read this place is a hit or miss.

R-Y-TY97rVeYQ70RqF04Pw.text: Best brisket! Smoked chicken and pulled pork were delicious as well. Good sides and a decent price for BBQ - which can actually get kinda expensive. Atmosphere was kinda meh - I would definitely recommend grabbing and going.

u7JwDnf1lUm487HbzVnVKQ.text: Had an amazing experience tonight! Food was outstanding! Great service by Tracy and Raul. And I love the hot barbeque sauce! The pork didn't stay on my fork for very long, I kept shoveling it in my mouth!!

FbrPLjqZr9dDQAQTmv35AA.text: My husband and fellow yelper bookmarked this hidden gem a few months ago. We were downtown today after a meeting at his office, and he suggested we try Pork on a Fork for a late lunch. I agreed and was not disappointed! I love BBQ, and have been to several BBQ joints, and POF was top notch. When I checked in I received an offer of 25% off!! Awesome!  POF is located in an outdoor mall, I felt it was hard to find, as it was our first time here and the signage was lacking letting us know where to go. After walking a bit, we finally found it. We walked in and was met with hello's and big smiles. After reviewing the menu, which is on a digital board, I decided on a pulled pork sandwich. It came with 2 sides and I chose the mac-n-cheese and waffle fries. The fries were fried fresh upon my order, and were hot, crispy and delicious. The mac-n-cheese was omg yummy. It had just a little kick to it, not overwhelming. My sandwich was okay. Here's where my personal preference comes in, although the pork was tender, I felt it was bland and dry. I put the sweet and mild sauce on, and I had to put a lot on to get it to my preference. The bun was soft and fresh. The restaurant was clean and bright. There are several big screen tv's, and colorful art. The prices were reasonable, and the customer service was good. I am glad we came to POF and I can't wait to go back, especially since my husband has their 25% off check in offer as well :) he saves his for later!

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with mac-n-cheese and waffle fries.

yeGIl32O8zbGw5Q25IONqQ.text: Well, the food was served cold, the sandwich bread tastes like it was purchased from the local grocery store with the bag left open all morning, and the corn muffins are dry and tasteless. Now that I think about it, the whole meal is dry and tasteless. Maybe I went at the wrong time.

I think the problem here is their Chiptole style setup where they allow the meats to air dry...

9ffqVYXfln0zYZsobX1hfw.text: This Kansas girl is always on the lookout for quality bbq and Pork on a Fork did not disappoint. The key to identifying a good bbq joint is their brisket. Theirs was perfectly smoked, great smoke ring just enough fat remaining to seal in the juices. The sausage chicken and pulled pork was just as perfect. Finally if you are a sauce person definitely try what they have to offer. Now what about the sides? Those too were made to perfection, don't miss the Mac and cheese and when they ask if you want seasoning on it say YES. If you are anywhere near one of their locations in Phoenix stop in!

YVTc9zWxQDXrIphOjWKTug.text: I have been here many times and love the food. The service, however, was really slacking last nite. I visited around 7pm. There was one couple dining in. I came in at the same time as one other couple who intended to dine in. I already knew I wanted my order to go. Three employees were behind the counter and nary a one of them greeted me ( or the couple behind me). I gave my order (pork sandwich w/beans n cac salad as my sides) . i ordered a drink n asked if any desserts were available. Yep. They still had one peach and one berry cobbler left. I asked for the peach and then while dispensing my lemonade went into a coughing fit that nearly made me pass out. The cashier stood on the other side of the counter and just stared at me, even as i dropped to my knees from coughing. I was rather embarrassed so as soon as i was able i grabbed my bag and stumbled to the door. I was all the way to the car when i realized she hadnt put my cobbler in the bag. I finally found the strength to go back for my cobbler. Said cashier wa nowhere in site so i told the young man I had paid for and did not receive my cobbler. He looked up my order on the register, then hollared to verify with the cashier that i had indeed paid for cobbler and she indeed do forget to put it in the bag. This whole process took probably another 6 minutes or so

EdPc9f2wDtmpyk1aAx4jcA.text: It's a decent bbq place for the area. There really isnt many other options close by. They have a pretty good bbq burrito, but the prices are pretty steep for what you get.

BbRyd9AJScxS0424xlSVLw.text: Excellent BBQ! We stopped at Pork on a Fork after visiting a friend in a hospital up the street. Fantastic  food and great atmosphere. The ladies behind the counter were welcoming and very nice. I ordered the deluxe sampler- chicken, pork, and brisket. The brisket and pork were the stars of the show, with the chicken close behind. BBQ sauces on the table were tasty as well. I liked the Zippy Mustard and Smokey Tangy the best. The baked beans were the best I've had in a long time. Coleslaw could use a flavor boost- I asked for some pickled onions on the side, and that helped the coleslaw quite a bit. They suggested the Mac and cheese to try, and I should have tried it instead of the coleslaw. Oh well, next time! I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k1CCe7Y6rk8gbT-mgDm4SQ.text: My advice is to go online and sign up for their reward program (rewardmebaby.com/porkona...) before you go in to eat, because you will be back! We went today at an off hour, so there was no waiting. We both sampled the brisket and loved it so that's what we ordered. The meat is hand sliced and weighed right in front of you and it's very moist and tender. For sides I had the mac and cheese and waffle fries and my husband had cole slaw and something else. The mac and cheese was worth ordering again and the fries were good for holding the sauce. There are 3 sauces on the table and the sweet and smoky one was my favorite - i'm a big fan of smoke. Everyone working today was friendly and seemed happy to be there.

9DVotMW2kCxa6831_Cp-XQ.text: BBQ to die for. I am definitely not a lover of brisket and wanted to ask the lady serving me to switch it out, but I was floored. The brisket is moist and tender and melted in my mouth. I always avoided brisket because it is normally dry and tough. I don't know what their secret is, but it definitely was the best on the plate. All of the meats were moist and juicy with a delicate smokiness. I liked that it was not overpowering.  I had the baked beans and coleslaw for my sides and both were delicious. Beans were well seasoned and slow cooked so that the flavors were developed through out. The coleslaw was crisp and well seasoned My favorite sauce was the tangy bbq. The hot was too salty for my taste but worked well if mixed together.  Service was great and would recommend for lunch or dinner.

Z22_Ja0jSg9HNNGbipEuyQ.text: Food was good. MAC n cheese cold. Cole slaw was grose. Baked beans were good. It wasn't so much the food but the delivery was sloppy. The bar b que sauce spilled all in the bag making quite a mess!!

rswgbVbn8feDPf4hpIsfHg.text: So so good not to be missed.  Great people and all the sauces on the table are amazing

AuJ2tLyTahuCwEskF25BsA.text: We got there at closing time so take out was our choice. We got platters - 3 or 4 meats with 2 sides. Brisket was good but dry-ish. The pulled chicken was delish. Good sausage, full of spice and juicy. We tried baked beans, Cole slaw, corn off the cob. A generic dinner roll is invluded. No butter or anything. It was ok. The Cole Slaw was juicy and crunchy fresh. We were offered s variety of sauces which highlights the flavor of the bbq. Good value, great flavor. I should ordered some ribs but there was more than I good finish as is.

J6RO4aBPk-W7wSCaBjMP_Q.text: After a little hiatus, Foodie Friday resumed yesterday and BBQ was the pick and it was delicious! My friend and I shared the platter where we could try 4 types of meat. Chicken, brisket, sausage and pulled pork. As for sides we tried potato salad, macaroni salad, mac n cheese and cornbread. My favorite was the brisket and mac n cheese. Delicious and worth a repeat visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 4 meat platter included chicken, brisket, sausage &amp; pulled pork. Sides we had were potato salad, macaroni salad, mac n cheese &amp; cornbread.

_O8S1lQJIwq4T4gwoove9A.text: Totally underwhelmed, tiny portions of mediocre food for big prices. Read the reviews, thought I'd try it out with my free dinner coupon from Uber Eats.  On the delivery menu the brisket and bbq sampler $13.11, you're prompted to add two meats (pulled pork and sausage for me) and two sides (Mac n cheese and corn bread) the price mysteriously becomes $21.10 plus tax and delivery.  It was free so I figured... Well, I was wrong, tiny portions of brisket and pork, half! of a so-so sausage and tiny boring sides. Save your money, you can do better at home. Never again Pork on a (tiny) Fork, never again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $21.00... I&#39;m still stunned at the audacity of a restaurant that thinks this is a sampler.

3xzz3JrINZLLa3odlD2O6A.text: The food here is awesome and you get alot. For your money. My husband and I tried the poaf on highland and i liked this location better than the North Phoenix one. The restaurant looks nicer and wasnt as busy. I will definitely come back here.

jWZUtYGP7jerf4lABn2Pmg.text: Metaphorical back to back to back orgasms in my mouth every time. I literally cry when my food is brought out. Mac and cheese is bomb. Sweet potato fries with honey mustard is fire

e2kXjdcUdoik3veqTVGZvA.text: It smells fantastic when you walk in but that was the only good thing about the place. The service is terrible. I had to ask for sauce for my bbq bowl 3 times, finally getting it after my entire order was bagged up. I watched a server sweeping scraps of meat onto the floor behind the counter. No one seems to know how to do their job.   If the food was good, I might consider going back but I found it fairly bland. It certainly wasn't good enough to make up for the horrible customer service. You lost me as a customer after my very first visit.

Owm63MvlT3DzHEHIeTfOOQ.text: First time here. I got the Deluxe Sampler (chicken, pork, brisket) and 2 sides (cornbread, Mac+cheese) because I wanted to try a little bit of everything.  It's not easy finding a good BBQ place in Arizona. This is the best one I've been to. All the meats were melt-in-your-mouth tender. My favorite was the brisket. Plastic fork, no knife needed for any of it. 4 sauces at the table (sweet, smoky, hot, zippy mustard) so you can have your choice of sauce. I tried them all and the sweet BBQ was my favorite.   Everything is made from scratch. The Mac and cheese was a strong co-star in the dish. I would have given 5 stars but the soda machine was broken so it was only tea, and I wanted a Coke to wash it all down with.  Very positive and recommended experience. I will be back for sure.

AoBcPXysQJjFaJethZNGBA.text: Missing items but fine whatever but OMG the dryest meat ever!  Mac and cheese is sub par no seasoning and the potatoe salad is gross!!  Bland,  dry,  and hard to swallow will never order again

P9G1YiJnFmS5AR6GuicFaQ.text: I had a small craving for BBQ and unfortunately after I was full the craving only became BIGGER. Now I fear I might be venturing out into the late night only seeking more of its deliciousness!!  I ordered a brisket sandwich with a side of BBQ beans and a side salad. It did cost more than I would like to spend and I wasn't able to finish it all. Kinda wish there was an option to just buy the sandwich and a bag of chips.

jl_GehRu8gIDaliSnzzjjw.text: We were looking forward to trying this place, were bummed to be disappointed. I found three LARGE chunks of sharp bone in my pulled pork sandwich. Got pork sliders off the kids menu for my son and most of the pork was a few cuts of super fatty pork, so thick I could barely cut it with the plastic fork. When we let them know about the bone they replaced their pork shoulder and offered us another sandwich and sides. The guy was very apologetic. Not sure if we'll give it another go or not. Appreciate he tried to make it better.

QxsHFJC5XfU1iauAthSG_A.text: The portions are not very big for the price. The meats were okay - tried the brisket and the pulled pork and both tasted solid but not anything special. I did enjoy the sides - the cornbread muffin and mac and cheese were both pretty good; unfortunately there wasn't a whole lot of either. The mustard sauce was also pretty good, so be sure to ask for that when you're here.

9LNbHpkH37lf55KX-dzv3g.text: Stopped by on Saturday - being born & raised in TX I thought I would fulfill a BBQ need.  Purchased two plates... Pulled pork sandwich w/2 sides consisting of waffle fries & the macaroni salad 2nd plate was a Sausage sandwich w/2 sides consisting of cold slaw & BBQ beans.  1.  Pulled pork sandwich = meat was generous, tasty and flavorful.  The BBQ sauce the provided added much flavor and was sweet and smooth - very good.  The waffle fries were very tasty, not hot enough... I would have liked them warmer but they were flavorful.  The macaroni salad was your standard "picnic macaroni salad" but had a lot of flavor to it.  2.  Sausage sandwich = generous serving and also flavorful (crisp casing and not greasy).  The slaw was a "no" not good - strange flavor, spicy cabbage.  The beans were average (mushy from over cooking) but flavorful.  Storefront was clean, quiet and almost empty (not a good sign or it could have been too late for lunch crowd - but on a Sat?).  The staff was friendly, cordial and quick.  They took my order timely and had it to me at the end of the counter and ready to go (and the order was correct).  Pricing was average, after all meat is expensive no matter where you go and you are paying for a MEAL (with two sides).  Overall rating... a 4 to 4.5.  I definitely will come back here when I get the need for beef... BBQ beef (or pork) that is.

WhJUY74nzoRcrqfIjUyR2A.text: O. M. G. I don't know why this place wasn't just overflowing with people. Not enough good things to say about this place. Great prices and definitely not stingy when it comes to serving sizes! They give you so much food! Hubby and I both ate for a little over 20 bucks. Can't beat it!! Especially for bbq. LmOE5uwAh17qcjQ3mRsVwg.text: I will preface this review by saying that this is my first one on Yelp; although I use (and appreciate) reviews on it frequently.  My partner and I eat out several times a week and like to try new places once in a while. We went here on a Sunday night (just got home from eating there) and there was one small family there. The girl who took our order didn't greet us and seemed quite apathetic. My partner has a Groupon, but was unable to download it on his phone. He asked the cashier, who we found out was also the manager, for the WiFi password. She said that the owner has it and she doesn't know it. No apologies, nothing. So my partner made a comment about the fact that she obviously didn't care. So, we figured we'd use the Groupon a next time (see where this is going?). My partner ordered waffle fries as a side. The girl who took our order called back for waffle fries, as none were available.   My cole slaw and mac 'n cheese were pretty good. My pulled pork sandwich was pretty good too, except for the chunk of bone that I bit into. The sandwich was lukewarm at best and a bit on the dry side. But like I said, pretty good. So we were halfway through our meal and still no waffle fries. The acoustics are pretty good in the restaurant and we heard the "manager" and the girl who took our order talking about us. They mentioned something about calling the owner regarding the WiFi. My partner went to the counter to inquire about his fries. The girl who took his order asked "waffle fries or sweet potato fries?" Umm, she took our order about 15 minutes ago. So no waffles fries were put in the deep fryer. We cancelled the fries, as our meal was almost over.   So, decent food, but horrible service. Oh and there were dirty napkins on the floor and food scraps on some tables - with only a few customers in the place. We'll get a refund on that Groupon and move on...

Bj_pQwVXr_8jm7AWwRLgUg.text: Great barbecue place.  I go here every couple of weeks during my lunch break.  The pulled pork bowl is my favorite.  The manager has worked hard to get good staff in there with him and this place is a hidden gem.

v92EFXpc4HfQeqlvytG_eQ.text: Normally Pork on a Fork is my go to for lunch and tonight I decided to get it for take out for dinner for me and my husband. I regret this decision as this is by far one of the worst meals I have ever had.   For $30, I got a Beef Briskit meal and a Briskit BBQ bowl. They gave about half of the portions of both meat and sides then they do during Lunch hours, which is a mixed blessing as the flavor was severely lacking. My BBQ bowl was more than 50% potato salad. This normally would not be a big deal as I usually love POAF's potato salad, but tonight it was a gloopy, watery, odd tasting mess. It is pretty gross and I tried separating out as much edible food as I could. My husband took one bite of his potato salad and scraped the rest into the garbage.   The meat in my husband's meal was very fatty. He did like the flavor, and was satisfied with the cornbread muffin, paltry as it was. Most of what I brought home ended up being thrown away. If I lived closer I would have taken it back. Instead this was a very expensive lesson: avoid Pork on a Fork after 2pm.

Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband&#39;s Briskit meal. This was over $11 before tax and tip

N5SyZPPum1HWN1ngQhJfBA.text: If I could give no stars, I would give that rating with no hesitation.  This establishment is nearby our place of work and we happened to remember their food was quite delicious in the past.  The food was great but the to-go service has an opportunity for change.  Initially, we had ordered through Grubhub.  Busy day and we couldnt leave the office.  So through the app, we had ordered two pulled pork burritos and a deluxe sampler with brisket, sausage and pulled pork.  When the order came, the deluxe sampler was missing the sausage (which was subbed for chicken), the burritos had no rice or beans, and no bbq sauces were packed with the order.  The issue here is that the deluxe costs more so we were charged extra for something that was lower on the menu.  We called Pork on a Fork and we were notified that the person packed the order was the manager.  We were told that the manager himself had packed the order so the order must be correct.  Also we were told that the burrito did not come with rice or beans so it must be added as a side, to add them into the burrito.  After being on the phone for a few minutes, the manager stated that we would receive store credit for a future visit.  So taking his word, we ordered the next day to use this store credit.  So this time, instead of using the Grubhub app, we ended up calling in the order.  We ordered the deluxe sampler and the pulled pork burrito.  We asked to add the beans and rice.  The lady on the phone immediately told us that it automatically came with beans and rice....  So disregarding that comment, we asked to have sausage, brisket and pulled pork.  We commented that we had store credit and we heard in the background, the manager states, "yes i know them, they have store credit."  Though once he heard that we ordered the deluxe, we heard, "No they didnt order the deluxe.  They get chicken, no brisket or sausage."  After disputing the fact that it literally shows "Deluxe Sampler" on the Grubhub app, to no avail they said no.  We then cancelled the order.  The food here is decent but it really isn't worth the headache of the management.  We were here a few weeks ago prior to this snafu and couldn't figure out why it was dead at noon.  Now we know why.    There's plenty of food options around this area.  In and out, Panera, Wendy's, multiple pizza options, Whole Foods, I could go on.  Plus dropping $50 for lunch isn't exactly the cheapest.  We will not be back.

HZ6bL4B9McH0b02gzFlXMw.text: Oh my god this place gets a five out of five star review!!! Why??? Because they are that freaking awesome that's why!!! Let me tell you I have been craving barbecue for a long time but I'm very picky about my barbecue, but Yelp suggested this place to me and I read all the reviews and decided to give it a go and I am soooooo glad I did!!! This is definitely bookmarked and my new favorite barbecue spot. :D   So let's talk about the food, I ordered the Midwest monster (which comes with not one but TWO sides) and for my side I chose the honey barbecue beans and the mac & cheese. Both sides were freaking phenomenal! The mac & cheese was just as cheesy as I like it, and the honey baked beans literally reminded me of barbecues with my family. The Midwest monster- ugh! To die for!!! It's half pork and a half brisket, The meet is nice, juicy and tender and mix with all the right flavors! For my drink I got a sweet tea (i'm addicted to sweet tea) and not everybody sweet tea is good, but there is exactly what you expect Southern Sweet tea to taste like. :)  On top of everything else the staff was extremely friendly, the establishment was clean, and the atmosphere was nice. Definitely coming back for you!

eixkOMoNeFSoktv1JhVXdQ.text: This place is not the best bbq's the meat is super fatty and for the price you don't get enough meat. For the price you should be getting a leaner meat that you add great flavor to. The workers were nice that's about it. Flavor was good though just to fatty.

lpp_z1i4hyFC96jmLEzGbQ.text: The food was very good for a fast/casual environment. Wasn't expecting to have such flavorful BBQ from a quick place like this. The coleslaw was quite refreshing with great flavor, baked beans were excellent with a mild pepper taste, the chicken and pork were also excellent but the brisket was surprisingly dry. Assortment of BBQ sauces was a nice selection, decor was good. I would've given them 4 stars for food but I'm giving them 3 stars for service because there was only 1 person in front of me and the meat carver was painfully slow. There was no smile and I could barely hear what he was asking due to his mumbling. The 2nd server who compiled my sides was very nice and pleasant but I asked several times for something and even after I was seated, I realized I still didn't have it so had to get up and ask again. I'd give them another try again if in the area since I did enjoy the food.

M1li2hTi7IhULlQCSvcIpA.text: This is one of those places that I wish I could like it more than I do. They have a vast menu and quick service as you move down a Chipotle style line. Problem is I just haven't found any of their meats to be that amazing and their sides, other than the mac & cheese, are all just average. The mac & cheese is yummy though so I would recommend that.  Parking at this location can be a bit of a pain during peak times but there are quite a few 10 minute parking spots directly out front if you're here to grab takeout. oFQ6olXUzm75K--U4ms78A.text: Went in on the 5th around 4:00 pm.  I know it is a new location but the service was awful!  The lady at the register was rude to us & told us we had to order before we get to the register.  Went back to the food line to order & after waiting a few minutes with 4 employees ignoring us my husband asked if this is where we were to order.  We were told yes and were continued to be ignored.  We waited a while longer and our order was finally taken.  We get to the register to pay & they give our food to the lady in front of us.  We told them it was our order and not hers and they argued with us and told us that she ordered online so she gets her order first.  We argued again that it shouldn't matter - that was our order (not even the same thing she ordered) & they bagged it up for her anyway.  The lady at the register asked if it was our order and we said yes, but that is fine, we can order it again.  Then they pulled her order out of her bag and gave it to us where we again argued that it was her order and she had our order.  The manager lady did look very busy trying to train everyone but there was only one person in front of us.  There was no way the service should have been this bad.  My husband said the brisket was not good - I had the pork sandwich and it was ok.  They were out of cornbread so we had mac & cheese - nothing special & my son wouldn't even eat his.  Not sure we will be back after the service as there are a lot of other better BBQ joints around but the price was good and they are close so we may give them one more chance once they are open for a while.  Hopefully I will be able to update with more stars.

YVxPHaHh9CsqmRw6KzPQ8w.text: I was there with four other people, we were all a little disappointed because they only had a few sides to choose from - most were sold out, including the ones we wanted.  Four of us settled for coleslaw and mac n' cheese (which none of us wanted).  One had potato salad, which she said was made with badly under-cooked potatoes.  That lady is a very good cook herself (and owned and operated a barbecue joint with her husband for about a dozen years in NJ).  She said her pulled pork was good.  The rest of us had brisket.  It was a little dry and tough.  I was really hoping it would be very tender (not too far from falling apart).  I mixed two barbecue sauces on mine and was happy with it.  One was the smoky and tangy and the other was the sweet (and something).  I make my own sauce at home and confess to being pretty picky- but it was good, IMHO.  I found the coleslaw unsatisfying.  It was neither sweet nor tangy, but a little dry and bland, though it seemed quite fresh.  My wife enjoyed hers.  She and her Mom got theirs in a bowl and were disappointed that it was all on top of the meat (that is- the mac n' cheese  and the coleslaw were in the same bowl atop the brisket).  That's a bit strange, not in a good way.  To be fair- we got there a little on the late side (not realizing they close at 8pm on Monday).  So it's understandable they could run out of something (but we'd assume one of the meats, and not the sides which don't have to smoke for hours).  The employees were mostly nice (one young lady was trying to clean up and was a bit kurt).  Here's the strangest part of it all:  As we neared the entrance, we saw an electric smoker (and the smoke discs they use to impart the smokey flavor staked in a tube attached to the outside of the small box) outside on the sidewalk with a cord running into an adjacent part of the building.  That sort-of lowered my expectations.  Those expectations were not even met with our experience.  That said- two of our tablemates go there (the 20th street and Highland location in Phoenix) somewhat often and enjoy it, including the lady who is a good cook and a former barbecue owner/operator.  And they don't usually go 40 minutes before closing time.  So this could well have been a bad Monday night.  On the other hand 7:20 isn't so late to begin dinner.  I probably won't go back, given all the places I can count on being good.

QUKnsBL7_FXN8RKlZ8-IEA.text: Meh. Finally got around to trying it and I was pretty disappointed. The place was empty but there was tables that still needed busing. xhSnVMVE5V46PehuTMe3yg.text: This place did NOT disappoint. We used our Yelp check in offer so the 25% off was nice . Ordered the Brisket plate with beans and macaroni . Everything was bomb . NaaOIHu6P90yce5aQoN6CQ.text: Super fresh! Super good! Good size portion, reasonable price and lots of options. It's a good fast lunch spot and my husband and I have no complaints. 7u0g6JDlud7H6Idf1W1rAw.text: Great food.  The cuts are good and the meat is tender.  Great cornbread.  Beans good as well.  But the sauce is the boss as they offer 3 different types.  Relaxed location nice place to watch the game and enjoy some pork on a fork.

xesSde5HQOgXMi5XIP9H2w.text: I wish I lived closer because this would most certainly be our go-to! It was absolutely delicious! I got pulled pork, pulled chicken, and Brisket! Their mustard BBQ is sweet and tangy with a tiny bit of spice! Yum! Mac and cheese, CHECK! Sweet potato fries, CHECK! xAs_wj15XmdElXEAhW29fQ.text: You guys have lost me. I have come in numerous times over the years and ordered a pound of pulled pork and always used the yelp check in for 25% off. Tonight I went in ordered a pound of pork and the woman behind the counter said they couldn't offer the 25% discount on bulk meats, she even called possibly the owner on the phone and was still told no. If it's worth digging your feet in over 3-4 dollars, then I'll go somewhere else.

-tjtOzXuads__RTeopFM-g.text: Pretty good barbecue  Overall, Pork on a Fork was exactly what I would expect. The food was good and everyone left happy.  Pork on a fork offers five different sauces, from mild and sweet to smoky and spicy, including a mustard-based sauce, which was pretty good. On this visit find lunch Companions and I I had the pulled pork sandwich, a brisket burrito, chicken, coleslaw, cornbread, and macaroni and cheese.  All of our entrees were  tasty and I really had no complaints, other than I'm really not a fan of bbq.  The sauce selection was good, the cole slaw was not overly sweet though underseasoned, the macaroni and cheese , waffle fries, were all okay.  If you're in the area, and enjoy bbq, check out pork on a fork you won't be disappointed.

HR-OcxIkoCyNohJa4Ihpkw.text: Came here on 2 different occasions, the first one being for the Yelp elite event and the second was at my own leisure. I had a friend visiting town and I had a coupon given to us at the event. So why not bring her here since the first time the food was pretty good. We both ordered the brisket sandwich with 2 sides. I can remember the brisket being fresh and juicy at the event. Unfortunately the brisket served to us was rather dry. We came in around 5pm and I could tell the brisket had been sitting under the heating lamp so it definitely wasn't fresh. I don't know what they can do to make it better, but I was almost embarrassed I brought an out of towner here. I normally like to support local businesses, but this time around the food was not impressive. Phoenix has a plethora of BBQ joints and this will be my last time here due to the stiff competition around the valley.

oHeCQu-GS0cU4DD3hvvqrw.text: Really good bbq. Had a combo meat plate with beans and slaw. It was definitely worth the trip.

D3toYpb7gG7dJaFxJ636Iw.text: Pork on a Fork is not only delicious, but super affordable! Hard bbq is hard to find in my opinion and this place has nailed it. The brisket was so tender and Smokey it was incredible, high recommended! The Mac and cheese is warm, cheesy and what your cheesy dreams are made of. Last, the sweet potato fries came out straight out of the fryer! They have the perfect crunchy outer layer and the soft inside! 10/10! Oh and the staff is super helpful and kind which is always appreciated :).

VkXtdA5Mr73Z9V5nB09pxA.text: Outstanding pulled pork and side dishes.  Very friendly staff always greeted with a smile and very helpful.  Restaurant and rest rooms are clean.  Only gripe about the food is the portions of the sides are somewhat stingy.  Note to CCW holders this location is posted but the sign is hidden at the front door behind other signage.

h8QQCx-kf_P8zAYH-PyQVg.text: This place is a gem! Their food is delicious and they serve a nice portion. Very good lunch stop for us. Thank you!

vYR568Y7mT1iJ3Qom2aQTg.text: Pork on a Fork has been on my radar for a while after reading a fellow Yelper's review. Once again Yelp did not let me down. I don't get to Phoenix often as I live in the east valley, but today I had an appointment just blocks from here. My wife and I decided to stop in for a late lunch . We quickly spotted the POF van from Camelback. After a little searching we found the store on the back side of the mall. At some point you could just follow your nose to the source of the smoky BBQ aroma. Upon entering you are you are greeted with a slow bluesy background music. The place is clean and trendy with plenty of tables.  They must have thought we were nuts, because the first thing we did was to post a selfie by the POF sign in order to claim the 25% off coupon you get when you check in on Yelp. The wait staff greeted us warmly and took our orders. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with the highly recommended mac-n-cheese and baked beans for sides. I watched with anticipation as they carefully assembled my sandwich. A generous portion of pulled pork heaped on a fresh baked bun. I wish they would have thrown a couple sliced pickles on as well. One thing you must keep in mind, this pulled pork is not cooked in sauce. If you expect saucy BBQ pork, this is not it. What you get is tender, smoky, juicy slow cooked pork shoulder. There are 4 different amazing sauces to drown your sandwich in at your table.  The mac-n-cheese was fantastic. It was very cheesy, and had a bit of a zing to it. I think it may have been made with sharp cheddar. There was a seasoning sprinkled on top which was the perfectly complimented the dish. The macaroni was cooked perfectly, not sticky, not mushy. I could make this my main course and both sides also. It was truly the best mac-n-cheese I've ever had. The baked beans were good. They were even better with a little spicy BBQ sauce mixed in.  Jake came out to chat with us for a while. He gave us a little history of POF. I told him this was a place Guy Fiere would like. This is just the kind of place he would feature on Drive-ins, Diners, and Dives. Although the food was impressive what impressed me most is Justin's personal response to most of the Yelp posts. This tells me he cares about Yelpers. It's this kind of personal touch that scores POF a spot on my Outstanding Service list.

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Selfie by POF sign.
Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork sandwich and sides.

541bJZoB7wkCKHs-A8-XvQ.text: We orders two salads, $10 a piece expected some thing pretty hearty. It was like a dinner salad with a little meat on it. Total waste of money. If your hungry go somewhere else.

AsepYd8T3ZwuQJvvrGokyg.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful, making good suggestions. The pulled pork and coleslaw were excellent (though I wish they had a Carolina style vinegar sauce to go with.) The baked beans tasted as if someone dropped the pepper shaker in by accident. Great if pepper is your favorite spice, but I will not order those next time. Absolutely plan to come back!  Update one year later: stopped in today and didn't realize it was 15 minutes before opening time until I tried the door and it was locked. Disappointed,  but since I had a lot to do today, I headed back towards my car rather than wait. Someone came running out to catch me and said, "Please, come on in!" Made my day!  Got the Midwest Monster to go, and it was incredible as always. Thanks, guys!

PvtqmN7-_D8-NlmLpZZ9Fg.text: My favorite bbq place. I love all of the sauce choices and the pork is so good. But the Mac n cheese is literally the best macaroni I've ever had I could eat it forever! Also I love the inside of the restaurant it's so cool looking and family friendly. My only complaint is that this location needs waffle fries like the deer valley location!

YiZwvaGgS1At_1YxZagr2A.text: It was my first time going to the Camelback location and I was not disappointed! Its hard to find great BBQ in Phoenix and im so glad i finally found a spot. Five stars for their outstanding service and to die for BBQ. I recommend the pulled pork and the drool worthy mac and cheese.

-luE2NGE5_gsJJU1a7kTFw.text: Not bad, a little pricey, great pork sandwich. The mac and cheese and bake beans sides are better than average. The four different BBQ sauces are also tasty. The burrito BBQ meal is also a great meal. Too bad we're moving, we would be there all the time.

dymnsJ9jCcN4zmwG8dlbbA.text: Went with my mom because we were in the area and saw a sign for them. We got the big boy sampler and a sandwich. Her side portions were much larger than mine. They measure out the meat so that every portion is the same but the sides just go right onto the tray so its not very consistent..  The bbq beans and the coleslaw were great. The potato salad was average but the mac salad just tasted like vinegar.   The meats were about what you'd expect. Was okay. Nothing great, nothing terrible. The sauces were good but I would have preferred a side like fries so I could try out each sauce on something else before putting it on my meat.   The sandwich meal is a good deal but I wouldn't get the big boy again. Not worth the price I paid for it.

DUvt7L3HCjo5LqcnBROr_g.text: Just an average BBQ place. I would describe it more as a fast food BBQ place.. got the pulled pork sandwich pretty tasty but bit into a lot of fat- cornbread I couldn't eat because it was cooked for too long so it was hard and stuck to the wrapper not moist or fresh and the MAC n cheese was pretty good! The BBQ sauce was yummy but the hot option isn't really spicy at all- still good place to go if you're craving BBQ and in the area- 5 star for customer service!!

SuG4VwS31tIqBAseJRYidw.text: Love the pulled pork sandwich here!  Mac and cheese and bbq baked beans round out my meal perfectly.

jP2nth6Qp15G4hSuIpFzNQ.text: So glad they opened here! This is really decent BBQ... The prices are decent and the portions are generous. Definitely worth it on cheat day!

RjwEoTWj8GWnKYjeArXvCA.text: Let's take an inside look at this restaurant, which is trying to display that mom n pop family atmosphere. The food to die for, customer service above average. Company treating employees with respect and sticking up for the ones who are your image and who make up a good percentage of the family negative impact. I just got let go for one customer complaint due to a customer stating  i wiped the counter with a "sweat towel" kid you not, this is a real complaint. The owners said they watched the cameras and they felt that since i worked in food for so many years as a manager that it was completely unforgivable. Than following up with my immediate supervisor's comment to me asking if it was real and saying I feel it could have been felt with differently because I know I didn't do such a thing. She stated Maybe you did it without realizing what you were doing. I am not sure. All I know is the lady called the Deer Valley location because our number is not online. That is how it even got to the owners. And they said fire her.  Thank you for that single complaint, I was unemployed 2 years and was blessed to get a job. I just was trying to find a stable home since being homeless is so difficult to get around positively. But one person made me loose faith. I only want to be seen as a person not trash.

7xK-tqeHmFO6JEBXsrlK7A.text: its hard to give 3 stars sin e i think its a 2 1/2 place but rouding up.  i compare all bbq against my home state of tennessee.  i got the original sampler platter  chicken - actually moist and pretty decent sausage - pretty good. pulled pork - not bad but doeant hold a candle to tennessee pulled port beans - nasty one of the worst ive ever had mac salad - decent rendition  all in all not the worst place for bbq in arizona but not great.    ps your bbq sauces need major work.  could you introduce on with actual spice?  or a vinegar based sauce?

yFpYsGun_7zsuorHOhV3pA.text: Decided to give these guys a try on my way home from work yesterday.   I walked in to order take out.   I ordered the chopped pork sandwich, with waffle fries and corn muffin.   When I got home, no fries, and it wasn't like they were busy or anything.   Too bad, because the pork was fairly tasty.   I would have rated them higher, but the service was lacking.

Ks1kJMCF3_aeNuEcIEuawQ.text: This is by far the best pulled pork sandwich I have ever had. The macaroni salad and corn bread muffin was awesome also. I highly recommend this restaurant

Nnn-uW-fxrLTKSzUpT3__g.text: Pork on a Fork 1949 E. Camelback Rd. Next to Fry's Food. As a native of Phoenix Arizona I can say unequivocally this IS the Best Barbecue I have ever had in all my 39 years of breathing.  My first visit and it won't be my last.  As soon as you walk into the restaurant the beautiful mouthwatering aroma filled the air.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and a cornbread muffin.  My hubby got the Big Boy Sampler which included a sample of all their meats; smoked sausage, pulled pork, pulled chicken, and beef brisket.  I ordered a fountain drink RC and found a seat.  To my delightful surprise I had the choice of 4 different sauces to compliment my delicious succulent barbecue.  I also had a taste of the chicken, sausage, and brisket thanks to my loving husband who shared some of his sampler.  After I enjoyed my lunch I met the manager Jake and told him how much I liked everything and how I will be coming back. Whether you are visiting Phoenix or a resident like me Pulled Pork on a Fork is a must!

VBi083RhTeUj0d0gy9ndXw.text: Stopped in Saturday afternoon and ordered the BBQ bowl with pork, mac & cheese and cole slaw.  Such a great combination...warm, cold, soft, crunchy.  I added their mustard-based sauce on top.  Also ordered a smoked sausage..just the right amount of spice and snap.  The place looks great and the staff was very friendly.  They also brew a variety of iced teas....loved the watermelon tea.

KtHVJHbb7euhHOWIln2Icg.text: Ordered the barbecue sampler and 2 sides of bbq sauce and when I got home there was no bbq sauce. Missing the best part made me realize the meat had a chemical taste. Very disappointed.

RgjUy5NZOph3kPeI1ei1Pw.text: Delicious food - everything was excellent except I wasn't wild about the sauce choices. I prefer a Kansas City style sauce, sort of a cross between their sweet and their smokey. Had the large sampler and all the meats were great. Had baked beans, potato salad, and an extra side of mac and cheese. Beans were very flavorful, mac & cheese was great. Service was beyond excellent -- Darius went the extra mile in service with a smile, even though it was almost closing time. Other staff were friendly too.

Xi_QXtAqAXtm8hFUtfziyA.text: Great sandwich with a choice of 4 different sauces on the table.....the side orders included were well sized and very tasty!  The mac and cheese was my favorite.  I didn't notice any desserts.......they need something to compliment the bbq like a key lime pie or something.

uCx0pJ5vNdP6uUFj-dC1oA.text: Great restaurant! Very clean! Very knowledgeable staff, locally owned . The food is fresh fast and huge portions . Really great flavor foods. Brisket sandwich is awesome!! Barbecue at its finest. This place is addicting.

0KwJuGYAbWu5WACSj8raMw.text: This place is wonderful. It has a different feel then the deer valley location but both locations are equally awesome.

UW7HfvrEgIm6B1Cw0_qmcw.text: Went in today for a sampler platter and it did not disappoint. The sides were banging. The baked beans were soooo good. Pork Belly was fantastic.  The peach cobbler was the real deal.  My husband and I very much enjoyed it and will return.

t6qxx_oJKEjwKiqODa6SEw.text: Had a wonderful experience both in food and service.  Sierra made sure to go out of her way to make my family feel welcome and taken care off.   The food is excellent, we had the ribs, pulled pork, waffle fries, sweet potato fries, and of course the corn bread muffins.   Everything was juicy, tasty, and thoroughly enjoyable.

hC58-DpsiwL5EtIWhmZhAQ.text: wow. wowwww. WOWWWWWW!  I like to think that being from Georgia I have a pretty refined bbq palate and I have to say this is my kind of bbq!  It's the kind of bbq you call your dad about to try (seriously, I called him in the middle of my meal!)  It's the kind of bbq you can't stop eating (I could have polished off two of these platters!)  It's the kind of bbq you would wait in line for (but who wants to do that in the Arizona summer??)  It's FAST! (Which is part of their tag line)  I was told they do a smoked prime rib once a month and 100% will be there for that one!  The meats were all amazing- perfect bark and bite on the brisket and ribs, super juicy chicken, just the right amount of heat and smoke. That shredded pork could be one of the best meals in Arizona.   All the sauces were on point. Normally I love a super saucey bbq but their meats really didn't need it. I love that they are all at the table and had to restrain from walking out with a few for home! Haha  Keep up the good work!

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All the meats!

ZRBdoMBzwnCovk2hXjWZ6g.text: Our 1st time in and using an introductory coupon thru FB.  We had the buy one sampler get one free.  A sampler is 3 meats, 2 sides, 2 rolls. It comes with pulled pork, pulled chicken and link sausage.  I substituted my chicken with pork belly, my 2 sides we're mac n cheese and a mini corn on the cob, my wife's we're mac n cheese and waffle fries, the pork belly came with a dipping mop sauce.  I was surprised the pulled chicken was as tender as the pulled pork, rare at BBQ joints.  All the meats had alot of flavor, tender and juicy.  The mac n cheese was beyond excellent and the waffle fries were excellent. The corn on the cob was kind of bland but I still ate it.  They had your standard pops, lemonade, teas.  I drank alittle each of the lemonade, sweet tea and Big Red soda.  I loved the inside.  Very modern.  Counter service.  The manager(female) explained our options and she came to our table to see how everything was, the history of Pork on a Fork, reward program which is unlike any BBQ place I've ever come across. I highly recommend Pork on a Fork.  It was delicious.

1L6RxctcXINGdCqZtJ7ANg.text: It was a crazy monsoon evening and instead of sitting in traffic on the 51 I decided today was the day to head over to Pork on the Fork to get some bbq!   After checking out the menu I knew I wanted more of a plater style and not so much of a sandwich, bowl or burrito, so I went with BBQ Sampler. My choice of meat, the beef brisket and for the two sides I went with the mac & cheese and bake beans.  The brisket was delish! It was smoky, tender and flavorful, though I did add some of the hot bbq sauce, so dang good! The mac & cheese is some of the best I have tried, cheesy good! Loved the baked beans, reminds me of the ones my grandma used to make.  This was a great stop on a stormy afternoon. Look forward to coming back for some yummy bbq!

The Mac and cheese..... yummmm.... not much else to say there. The beans were tasty and the corn bread was a little dry but still yummy. If we head back in that direction we will be stopping. Y again!  Service: the two ladies working there were awesome! They made suggestions for what would be good for our family to eat and the amount that we were going to need. This place was fantastic!

cEHc-t9bo5hP-y1tVLDS2A.text: It was forking delicious!!!!  I had the sampler plate and everything was flavorful and moist.  would definitely visit again.

ulj8fXw2Ewf6ZD-L2lK9cg.text: We wanted to try this place after watching it on Diners Drive ins and Dives with Guy Fieri. Upon arriving the place was empty even though we stopped by a hour before they closed or the foods sells out, that's what the sign said. We got the Sampler plate with  four Meats( Pulled Pork,Chicken,Beef, Sausage) and you can add Baby Back Ribs to your order. Our sides Mac n Cheese Potatoe Salad and Baked Beans. All the meats were dry, the ribs were tuff, to tuff to finish, It didn't taste like they were cooked long enough and the Mac n Cheese was old, the other sides were ok. Customer service was fine. We had high hopes for this place, we left disappointed.

ppmKel_Jk2kzYnGF7IlTLg.text: Best BBQ I've had outside of Texas.  Good selection of BBQ sauce, the BBQ beans had a nice spice to them.  I got the pork/chicken/brisket combo. My favorite was the chicken.

T98XtsRsD0fWJmYtFaJhaQ.text: The pulled pork is absolutely delicious. It was very flavorful. I'm not much of a pork person but this pork is something else. Their Mac n cheese was also very good, very cheesy and the seasoning made it that much better. Bbq beans were the perfect match with the meat and Mac n cheese. Not just that, the ladies working were very helpful in finding something I would like. They let me try the food and they were very patient. Great service and great food!! I am definitely coming back and bringing all my friends. 10/10 would recommend to anyone visiting Phoenix.

siJZAqPHq-bb5y3zaAyLvA.text: Over the years I had been to the original location in deer Valley about 1/2 dozen times.  I recently had been here for a Yelp event and was happy to see the food was still great. Several times a year I get together with an old high school buddy and he insists I choose where we eat. Sometimes I pick a place I want to try and sometimes I pick a place I want to show off. This was a show off place. I had forgotten he lived only a mile away and shops at the Fry's in the same center. We each had ribs and I had the macaroni and cheese and Cole slaw. I really like my ribs not to need sauce and a bit of chew to them rather than fall off the bone. These did not disappoint. I have always liked that their sides have as much attention to how they taste as the meat does. I know I will be back again at some time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baby back ribs with Cole slaw and Mac and cheese.

FsI62f0qchaUsUTCwlWe7g.text: I have heard great things about this place and have had some brisket from this place.  The other day we ordered the baby back ribs.  They were terrible. TOUGH AND CHEWY definately not the fall off the bone goodness with most other rib places.  DO NOT order the ribs!!

i2q5Lj_ggNCSaCaPFryV1g.text: Went here cause I heard from their social media person.   I had previously written a followup review stating that I felt the rack of ribs was extremely dry, at which point I heard from one of the owners -- or the owner, Justin.   He suggested I give them another shot, at which time I ignored him.   Then, surprise!  I got an email from the aforementioned social media person stating they had found me.   Well, I was really encouraged to give them another shot, which I did.   I, again, ordered a full rack of their ribs.   I asked for a nonfatty rack, at which time a woman behind the counter was arguing with me that all racks are the same, that is, not fatty.     Uhhh, I have grilled ribs, and I know that they can be fatty.   In fact, I have had fatty ribs at other restaurants, and I don't like all that fat.   Ughhhh!!  The young man brought out the ribs they had; I asked which was the leanest, and he pointed to a rack, which I bought.   Yummm!   I am happy to report they were not dry, and were the same good, smoky, flavorful ribs I had remembered from my original visit to the store.  I am impressed that the owner made such an effort.   I don't really like giving reviews that are less than stellar, but I guess I just like giving my opinion, no matter what it is.   I have gone to restaurants where the reviews were not all that great, and I have had a good experience.  The same could be True for the opposite, that is, the place gets great reviews, and my experience with the food was that the food is awful.  Yes, I will definitely be back.

kb6CPThyVodptjxXT_X84A.text: This was probably the best pulled pork sandwich I've had in years.  I really enjoyed the "choose your own sauces" at the tables.  My husband had the brisket.  It was tender, perfectly cooked.  All meals served on silver trays (nothing fancy) and sides were in separate containers.  They keep it simple & focus on taste.

B0-ACwIFAqIao7NeEJ85Vg.text: Pork on a Fork is one of those restaurants that has grown on me tremendously. Initially, I was not impressed with their food. The more I come back, the more that I find that I actually really enjoy their brisket. I can't say the same about their chicken or sausage. I find that they are dry and unsatisfying. As far as their brisket, there are times that they have made it the way my favorite barbecue joint has (Little Miss BBQ) - perfectly seasoned, crispy bark on the tender brisket. They have a number of barbecue sauces but I only really like the regular one. As far as sides, I've always been impressed with their beans. Their potato salad is pretty good as well. The rest of the sides unfortunately need some work.   Overall, Pork on a Fork has some room for improvement in some aspects but has the potential to be greater. In the meantime, I will be making my way here for their delicious brisket!

YUuwigUJBrwR-eVFyu5FaQ.text: It was okay. Service was good, the price is reasonable, the sauces are good, but man is the meat dry! The beans also have this warm apple sauce taste to   Update**   Been back a few times cause I like bbq. Pork is very good as is the taco special they do on Tuesdays. It's not the greatest bbq out there, but it's pretty good, the price is reasonable, and the service is good enough. It's a good lunch spot.

jqSRl15aSEyQw2x0A4j5gg.text: Great food and place. Amazing brisket made fresh, pork is tasty, sausage is amazing, their sides are awesome.  Enjoy it here.

3LrX2giV6AnMeLMKaKTK1Q.text: Peg and I are always on the lookout for small (as in not a chain of more than a handful) places to eat. Throw in BBQ as a main attraction, and we are ALL in.  Last week, we checked out this place. Almost everytime I go to a BBQ place, I check out the chicken/turkey as you can tell the kind of care that is taken to not overdo. Not only was the chicken wonderfully moist, the pulled pork and brisket was VERY good. A choice of sauces tableside complemented the meal. Side dishes, which have a tendency to be relegated to second class in a lot of BBQ places, were equally tasty and didn't taste like a #10 can of anything. The beans were well simmered with chunks of brisket and the potatoes were roasted and flavorfully seasoned. We would recommend highly...and will be back!  Dr. B

dXT-SMHYCJsi73_SW2h6VQ.text: Stopped in for dinner. Got the mix combination brisket, chicken, and pork. Brisket and chicken were good. Pork was ok, nothing special. The sides were mac and cheese and corn bread. I would recommend not using corn bread as a side. You get 1 small muffin and it was dry. My opinion you pay more and get less not only on quantity but taste as well. The bbq sauces stood out the most in my meal. Vinegar based. Tangy and spice.

hAcZnVMze0OELfxjc3hJHg.text: The menu on this page is not the menu for this location. We were looking forward to waffle fries and chicken tenders but they don't have a fryer. The meat is tough and sides are bland!! Will not be back - very disappointed. If you want bbq, go to little miss bbq!!

xf39jderR3ABMtU5paU5WA.text: Love this place!!! Great portions and super friendly staff.  Last time I was in the owners came by my table and said hello! Nice small business feeling.

QnVBFRFKqQ--CR9yqHrpxg.text: Have not been there in several months. The one thing that stands out most is that the food is overpriced for the meat portion. The side dishes are generous. Ordered one portion of brisket which was not enough to feed one hungry person, got more but of course had to pay additional cost. However, brisket was delicious. Not sure if we will return.

n7lNmFtkZ1YgKVyn2YqpPw.text: Great store and staff good job Camelback store !!! Great bbq the staff was awesome! Reminds me of Texas BBq!!! Good job guys! And gals!

-JMK2jDnJgMMYp_Do-Lsow.text: Excellent food!   Very clean place with friendly staff.   I had the pulled pork and homemade mac n cheese.  Yum!  Highly recommend this place.  I'll be back for sure:)

fonhkZyAJmVs64iSJJ1x_A.text: Writing this after my second visit:   Food is pretty good, but the service needs attention! Hoping the owners and/or mgmt read and address the following. I live within walking distance, and bbq is one of my favorite foods.  My 3rd visit will be make or break for this place.    1st visit, March 2016: They were open approx 2-3 weeks, we had a party of 5 adults and 2 young kids.  I think our bill was around $70.  After leaving, we all agreed the staff was the worst part of the visit: lack of attention, lackadaisical attitude toward customers, less-than-professional counter attendents, we were generally not impressed.  When we ordered, 3 of us ordered mac-n-cheese for our sides.  The kid behind the counter said "We've run out, we're making another batch now and it will be ready in 5 minutes".  That's understandable, no big deal.  We sat down.  There were approximately 3 other tables of customers there, so not busy by any means, and we were the largest group at that time.  We sat within sight of the cash register.  20 minutes later, as I was finishing up my Pulled Pork sandwich, I decided to get up and ask the guy if our mac-n-cheese sides were ready yet.  He said "Oh yes" and asked how many I needed, to which I replied "3", and he handed them right over.   Why didn't they bring them to our table when they were ready?  Did he really forget how many orders were needed for the item that they were out of?  Wouldn't this be a priority for them?   Anyway, at least we thought our food was tasty.  We chalked up the oversight to new employees and a new restaurant.    2nd visit:  3 months later.  We arrived at 11:20am, they open at 11.  Guy 1 stood behind the cash register, I'm not sure what he was doing, but he had no customers at that moment.  There was one table of customers already seated and eating.  Guy 2 was putting together an order right in front of the 3 of us.  We were looking at the menu for a minute or so, but about 4 to 5 minutes passed before anyone acknowledged us.  We saw the line cook throw a large bag of frozen waffle fries from the cold storage to the countertop (fresh - never frozen?).  Finally Guy 2 took our order.  Then Guy 1 rang us up.  Bill was $48 including the 15% tip I left (which sort of irks me - because nobody brings your meal to the table or waits on you - the staff does nothing more than a McDonalds employee does. I'm happy to leave (and usually at least) a 20% tip when wait staff does what they're supposed to do.)  These guys were nice enough, but both acted like they'd rather be somewhere else.  I then went to get my drink - and the floor between the soda fountain and the tea was completely sticky as if some kid had spilled a soda... but there were no kids inside and they had only been open 20 minutes.  Kinda gross... and inattentive especially considering Guy 1 wasn't doing anything for the first 4-5 minutes we were in the store, not to mention he was standing only 4 feet from the sticky mess.  ??  I might expect that at Peter Piper... but not at a place like this.  Anyway, again, our food was at least tasty.  And then my buddy (who I was taking to lunch), unprovoked, made a comment at the table to the effect of "the staff sure isn't helping this place at all".  Which is my entire point... there are too many restaurants in this area to choose from to spend that sort of money and feel like the staff could care less if you were even there.  I was hoping they'd have the staff ironed out 3 months into being opened.  I'll try again next month I guess.     Bottom line: good food, lousy staff.  Pork on a fork - you're soooo close to being my "go-to".

5ZFfYrLVnH7TmcQKWl4v7w.text: This place has the best brisket bowels and they are fast. I think the best part is that they are one of the restaurants that use Users delivery service. From the time I decided to order till Uber brought it to my door hot none the less was then then an hour.

sxF9t3pOLWc_BHWbXWI6uA.text: Spent 120.00 on a huge feast to go. Picked up order and requested all of the sauces to be included. We  didn't get one. By the time we got the food and realized we didn't have any sauce we were annoyed and no one wanted to drive back. Meat was ok, probably would have been good with sauce. What a waste of 120.00.

0qI73MUPQJWWbP4pCLf2CQ.text: The pulled pork was good but their buns were dry, like they had been left out too long.  They do have a variety of 5 sauces to choose from.

3AF2_W5guby28s1rruNlJg.text: This place is great! I get the BBQ burrito every time and it's awesome! The portions are huge and include your choice of two sides which are delicious. Mac and cheese is my favorite. This place reminds me of a chipotle where u walk up and order exactly what you want down the line which is great for the fast paced lifestyle or if you just want to sit down and have a nice meal. Also, the sauces are delicious. Try them all.

ed-AfGbU13htGeePr-eVhg.text: Deliciousness.!!! First time here and the customer service was great as well as the food. Ordered it online and it was prepared on time once I showed up.

bUkdGngbhNtDurMY1b0K7Q.text: I visited this restaurant for the first time today and loved it.  I had the 1/2 rack of ribs with beans and mac and cheese.  The ribs were meaty and delicious and not too fatty.  The mac and cheese was excellent with a complementary smoky flavor.  I like how fast it was served too!  I can honestly say I was in hog heaven...lol!

KBn4YgNDrAPfOh2tJHVFHw.text: I had the babybacks Ribs... Yum! Out of the 4 sauces they offer at the table, 2 were my style.. Great! The basic mop sauce the ribs come with was perfect... No need for anything additional but worth trying! Fast, clean and family friendly.  I will bring my whole family here for sure. I think my young kids will love the many options!!!  BTW-my first Yelp review...

umpTVgHhdN9sSv7uaMESdA.text: YUM! Our go-to BBQ place nearby closed recently so we've been on the hunt for smoked meat.   Upon entering I was pleasantly surprised by the decor. The walls and front of the food line are covered in distressed wood that actually looks smoked itself. A nice touch! There are several tables for seating as well as a wood bench that runs the length of the dining room.  The menu has enough components that you will never run out of options. Hubby got a BBQ sampler with chicken, pork, and brisket. The chicken was his favorite. He chose rice and potato salad as his sides. I tried the brisket bowl on top of baked beans, topped with coleslaw. It was tasty but next time I'll order something on a tray. I'm a food separatist but I powered through and ate everything mixed together. I also ordered a side of Mac n cheese for $1.99.  Overall we were pleased with the meal and ambiance and we'll definitely be back!  Edited to add: four stars for food, the fifth added because of awesome customer service... and a clean bathroom that makes you feel as if you just walked into a saloon!

kf-_YZ_8YGJsIj8QjwZgcQ.text: Not too bad, sort of like a Chipotle but for BBQ, food is very good, service was a tad slow, prices are a tad high. Had the Salad with chicken on top, pretty good but they didn't seem to know what to put on it besides lettuce and chicken. Soft drink prices are insane, $2.25 and RC, no pepsi, no coke, I'll pass, at least they gave me a full size cup for water. Atmosphere is decent . I'll be back...4 stars.

Z6RsuNhNTRhUcrMtndp5XQ.text: So excited they opened their second location on 20th Street and Camelback Road. I've been going to their original location on Deer Valley Rd for years. Just like the original, the ribs are incredible, the pulled pork is smoked to perfection and the Mac and cheese is simply addictive. Can't wait to have them cater my next event. And what makes them even better... they are locally owned and operated. Simply the best BBQ in the valley.
