V9oIYhcjbBYhXLS5QyWkqQ.text: I give this place a 3 stars because of their customer service.  I've been to this place a few times, the food it's generally pretty good, the only thing I didn't like is their ribs; they are on the dry/burnt side. However, the rest of their meats and sides are really good. Meats are juicy, well portioned. The sides are homemade (most of them), my favorite are the mac n cheese and the macaroni salad. Their barbecue sauces are savory, spicy, tangy...really good.  The reason for the 3 stars: CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE. I ordered once through UBER eats, and the person at the counter messed up, and did not give one of the dinner plates to the driver. When the driver arrived at my house, I asked for the other plate, and he said; "I specifically asked the girl if that was it, and she rudely replied "yes, that's it". So, while the driver was still at my house, I called the restaurant, I was placed on hold for a while, and finally they answered, the man I talked to said they gave everything to the driver, that he personally had given it to him, and to contact UBER. Luckily, the driver stayed w/ me for the entire talk, and he jumped in, told him that a GIRL was the one that had given him the order, not him, and to not lie about it; that's when the guy at the restaurant got nervous, and put the girl on the phone. The girl, still being rude, told the driver...ok, your order is here, come get it. UBER driver went to go get my order, brought it back, and told me that he was not paid for this extra drive, and that the "kids working there had showed him some attitude". Later that day, I got a call from the manager at the restaurant who apologized and offered me some credit for my next visit. Last week, I went in to use the credit, the restaurant was EMPTY, no customers, and 2 people behind the counter did not greet me, smile, and just stared at me. I approached them, and told him that I was there to get some credit for something that had happened in the past, still, nothing from them, no apology, nothing to make this experience better, one of them went to the back to check for my name on their list, and when he came back, he asked, "what do you want?". Again, the attitude was horrible, they were not rude, but honestly, no enthusiasm, I walked out of there feeling depressed. Again, the food was delicious, but the customer service is a disaster. I truly hope the owner/manager pays attention to that, because it could really bring down a restaurant...a GOOD restaurant.

-bol2oYagDoRLfqKMw2RGg.text: The meat was very well cooked but I couldn't really tell the pork from the chicken. I was rather disappointed with the barbecue sauces. This is not the place to come if you expect your barbecue to come off the grill.  The sides we chose were good -side salads (two choices for dressing), Cole slaw,  baked beans. The service was on the slow side. It was clean, and not too noisy. Overall, other than trying something new, I probably won't return here in the foreseeable future.

vEszVX1F477fSk-1NOlnRA.text: Second time here wasn't so grand. My bowl was quite a bit smaller than the first time, same amount of meat but everything else was scarce. They were out of de pepper and claimed none of them knew how to change it. Umm okay.

Zmx35rU6d-judGSiNretpw.text: Dammmmmmmm!!!!!!!!! That's some good BBQ. This is going to be my new BBQ spot. The price is right and they're not stingy with the meat. I would definitely recommend this joint to everyone. I will be back. Oh yea, I got to give a shout out to Daniel one of the coolest servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork with mack and cheese and potato salad

xzyd7JFhwzP1fANmHqGGGQ.text: Came here to test out for work as a potential catering option. Had such high hopes, maybe it was a fluke. Co-worker had told me how delicious, moist & tasty the food was when he had it at a wedding-sadly I was let down. Ordered the BBQ Sampler-Deluxe (pulled chicken, pulled pork & brisket). The pulled chicken was dark meat & very tasty to my surprise. The brisket & pulled pork both was dry & bland. With all the meat a dinner roll would have been nice, but no. Baked beans were yummy & peppery. Mac&Cheese was a bit grainy. Workers were really nice, but a bit slow for the lunch time crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Pork on a Fork - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ Sampler-Deluxe: pulled chicken, brisket &amp; pulled pork (left to right), baked beans &amp; mac&amp;cheese.

voC9CmpLcQ2sFyjsJdf6aw.text: Amazing macaroni and cheese. Perfectly smoked pulled pork. For delicious homemade barbecue sauce has choose from. Fresh baked beans made from scratch. You can get your food in a sandwich, Bowl, burrito, sampler or more

qZmAwC7mfIzvc0Dc_45sMg.text: My 1st visit was awesome. I got my food to go. Didn't know what to order so the guy suggested something with 3 meats and 2 sides. Cost was less than $16 and more than enough to feed 2 people. The meat was perfectly smoked and served with the sauce on the side. I ordered chicken,  beef brisket, and sausage with sweet potatoes fries and Mac and cheese. Food was great and I will go back as I work right across the street. Want to try the peach cobbler next time. Great job guys!

jLQWHzzGXg4-NCDsquQq3g.text: OMG. We LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place. My husband loves BBQ Ribs, so I decided to have his bday here. The place is super clean and I like the layout of the place and the food is just amazing. I ordered the sample platter that came with, brisket, chicken, sausage with two sides which I picked the Mac and cheese and coleslaw. AMAZING. My husband of course got the Ribs. AMAZING. Everyone at our table loved there food. I think what makes this place really stand out from other bbq spots is there sauces. It's like liquid gold. Besides the delicious food, the staff and management is super friendly and they made my husbands birthday perfect. Highly recommend this place. Can't wait to go back.

GA46QuUXzd1MAL1ENO-V-g.text: I noticed when this place opened because I love great BBQ and the fixins. I was REALLY disappointed. for  $14 and some change I tried the Brisket sandwich with Cole slaw, cornbread and a drink. 2.25 for a med sided drink is high-even with free refills. the sweet and mild BBQ sauce was tasty but the sandwich was short on meat, the cornbread was no different than I make at home, room temp and served with a cold butter pat.  The cole slaw left a lot to be desired. It lacked luster, flavor and actually seemed dry. I exchanged it for potato salad that tasted slightly better than the stuff sold at grocery. The last gets the star..tasty. If you know good BBQ you will be disappointed. Staff was friendly and helpful.

vn4uCO_WrJo3YpiNJRUP3g.text: Yumm!! I was so excited to find this hidden gem. Really cool atmosphere. The food is delicious. It's set up kind of like Chipotle, so once you walk in the door you'll have food in your hands within minutes if not seconds. Their sauce selection is excellent and caters to all different taste pallets. Good pricing and great food! Will definitely go here on the regular. OH, and did I mention the great selection of local brews on tap!?

YYXamUEZ7ylnoqqt36oiqw.text: Amazing brisket and smoked sausage , great mac salad. And good services and prices. Will be back!!

H9urminHwwZlcUo1koSaWw.text: Not sure how the meat is cooked, but the pork lost its texture and disintegrated when eaten. Strange how the texture of the meat was so off. Nice service. Bummer.

t0vG5X4GfwSCXzfroFWtqw.text: Ate here last night and the BBQ plate that I had was so so.  Beef brisket was tough, shredded chicken was a tad too dry and the pulled pork was ok. Ended throwing away the brisket! The corn bread was so small it shouldn't be considered a side!  It was just meat and 2 sides and they don't even give you bread or roll.  In Texas where I came from, BBQ there is so much better and they give you all the hot rolls you want!!  Since moving back to Phoenix we had tried other BBQ places here and they were better!  Well tried this place one more time 5-1 -17. Most likely will never come back! Had their pulled pork sandwich and the bun was very stale and hard! Pulled pork was terrible and had so many hard pieces in it. Had a side salad and it just came with lettuce and a couple of cherry tomatoes with ranch dressing that tasted like it was old! I think I'll go now over to Dickeys instead!!

XvwwWOy1tU6su9MxuntIWg.text: This place has amazing food tender seasoned well and the portion sizes are exceptional. The staff is amazing. Alundis, Luwey, and Karl all are professional and you can tell they were raised well because they all address you as ma'am, or sir and they are polite and patient. This place is definitely customer-focused. Don't believe me go by and try for yourself. Tell them Karen sent you.  What a blessing.

2K2Fl2RytPM1wPMoLlxnNg.text: The food is decent but it is a little pricey for the quality. I've come to expect that with this place, very skimpy on the portion sizes. When someone who spends the amount of money that We do at this restaurant asks for extra bbq sauce the restaurant should oblige. You will not keep customers by being a cheapskate with the sauce. You can always add an option on UberEATS for people to purchase extra sauce if need be but for Pete's sake stop acting like jerks always ignoring the request. There are other options for bbq in the area!

I4Qip2eoFJZueYJx-9VXJQ.text: I took a chance and tried this place out for their catering for a work event for 50 people for the first time, and I have to say, we were all very impressed!!! Not a single person had anything bad to say about the food, in fact everyone was talking about how good it was. We ordered 10lbs each of the pulled pork and shredded chicken, which was all very juicy and delicious. We also got the large pans of Mac n cheese, cole slaw, and potato salad. Our order was ready for pickup just before our scheduled pick up time which was great, and the helpful guys carried it all out to my car and made sure to place the cole slaw on top so it didn't get hot. Great customer service!! They are also on fivestars, so with that big order I also earned a couple free meals and I've redeemed one so far- the brisket with some Mac and cheese and the sweet potato fries. The brisket was AMAZING!!!! Better than some of the "best" BBQ places in a couple cities that I have tried! Was very tender juicy and flavorful and just melted in my mouth. The sweet potato fries were also perfect, crispy on the outside and soft and hot on the inside. Sauces were also very delicious! Will definitely be back, order again for catering, and recommend to my friends. And a side note their bathroom was extremely clean and smelled good, lol! Thanks so much Pork on a Fork keep up the great w(p)ork!!!

cDbLMyarq_rEcFqqOylm1g.text: Ordered catering for a company lunch. Justin showed up 10 minutes early which was greatly appreciated, not to mention he was very friendly. The food was packaged well and came with all the utensils we needed. Ordered the two meat option from the catering menu - pulled pork, pulled chicken and two sides, mac and cheese and coleslaw. Came with three types of BBQ sauce. Everything was delicious - it was a big hit in the office and a welcome break from the typical sandwich platters. Would most definitely recommend Pork on a Fork and will be using for future lunches! (Side note: order extra mac n' cheese because it is amazing and will disappear quickly!)

xa9LiELgrrtDRdAmn1b_0Q.text: I really really want to give five stars for POF.  I'm thinking even two is too much because the service was just plain horrible. On the two visits..mind you two days apart because the food is excellent, the service was so awful! No hello when walking in the door, a girl behind the counter was rolling her eyes when I couldn't make up my mind...hey, c'mon, everything looks good, let me have a couple of seconds since I've never been here! Second visit, same greeting..i.e. no hello..okay, ordering my food and I mentioned that we were just here on Thursday and the food was so good we had to come back and got zero response from both people behind counter..I was waiting for a great glad to see you back but I got nothing, nada, zip, no response, not even as much as a smile.  Ok then, wow!  The food was great! Don't expect good service here only good food.

9fCY6RzpeMkY4dBlVsdaKw.text: Love this place! Pork on a Fork has really stepped up their game. I had stopped going to their Deer Valley location when other options became available, but gave their new location a shot.  BBQ is going through a bit of a renaissance in the valley and it seems to be pushing everyone to do better. Pork on a Fork's brisket is way better than the last time I had it. This location features a quick, simple menu that gets you in and out quickly. Service is friendly, attentive, and fast.  I can only comment on the sides I've had which are the waffle fries, sweet potato fries, and cornbread muffins--all of which are very good.   Their Brisket sandwich is great and their sausage is a great add on. Good quality BBQ fast. Can't complain about that.

QDPoWTxnLBvmYNjRTbg1Nw.text: Wasn't great.   Heard great things, but wasn't impressed.    We got the sampler, ribs and a bunch of sides.  Ordered ahead and when we got there they said they accidentally sold the last of the ribs and forgot about our order.   Took forever after we paid, around 30 minutes.   Started out with a bad taste in our mouth, and then the food was just ok.   Although, we didn't get to try the ribs so not sure on those.

IIQU_wKK3VvTRQUSHBd0Kg.text: What a disaster.  I had the delux combined pork, beef, chicken sampler... cold all, dry. Service station messy. Only item that was hot were the beans... and somehow this is the best in phx.... No Chance....will not return.

PDKsblxN_B2DSnnvdaau-w.text: No Onions...really...out of cornbread..out of pickles...Inventory needs to be addressed.  Skimpy on sauces and sides are small portions.  I actually liked the food but don't think its run well.

QmOvATX9pby_R_jvk6NkIQ.text: Was out running errands and spotted this place with a "Grand Opening" sign so I thought I would give it a try. Ordered the beef brisket sandwich and they were out of a couple sides so I ended up with mac and cheese and waffle fries. Everything was pretty decent. The side containers for the beans and mac and cheese are pretty small while you get a pretty large portion of waffle fries, not sure why the disparity between the two. The sandwich was also pretty well loaded with meat and there didn't appear to be a lot of fat or funk on it, which is nice. The various BBQ sauces on the table were a good touch.

YLnttGwqIcij0jxCNhf11w.text: First time trying, ordered through Uber Eats. So far so good. And my son inhaled the Mac & Cheese. Fork optional...

29mFcHqbemwV2BxA0OMIPQ.text: The best bbq I've had in Phoenix.  I had the beef brisket bbq burrito and choose what I wanted in it.  Tons of choices, I had pickles, coleslaw, and others I can't remember.  Then I got to choose two sides, I had the beans and coleslaw.  The beans were delicious with big chunks of bacon.  The slaw was decent.  Staff is very helpful navigating the menu and how it works.  I can't wait to try something new the next time!

QKMpaav06tZvrYx45ZiOZg.text: Really good meat!  I had the ribs without the sauce.  I can tell you the rub was very flavorful.    We also had the pulled pork bowl.   The rice and beans were less than desirable,  but again,  the meat was really good.    They could improve on the side  salad... there was nothing to it really.    Only greens and a few yellow peppers.  They have other stuff to top it with,  but minimal (tomatoes,  pickles,  cheese,  corn ).   Definitely worth your time.  Your belly won't regret it!

axiRu2kK4e-q2qVTP8FWkg.text: This place smells like Morbid obesity and happy place dreams.  I was sooooooo impressed with the food!  The pork is flavorful, moist, tender, expertly cooked and seasoned and paired with a delicate bread.  I added Mac n cheese and it was also wonderful!!  I just came from Charlotte and it rivals the best from there!  Don't let the strip mall facade fool you.  If someone gives this place negative good reviews they are stupid....  This they can do better: home brewed sweet tea and lemonade. Get some!  Collard greens done well with fatback!

_oZ7dXvvP-Wke61e8xa1qQ.text: Had a great experience with Pork on a Fork this past weekend. I needed some food for a party, sent a message on Yelp and promptly received a reply. I called to place my order and Kylie was very helpful in answering all of my questions. We ended up going with 2 of the extra large family platters. Those are great because you get 4 different meats, so there's something for everyone. All of the meats and sauces were delicious! My guests ate every bite so the food was a huge hit! Great customer service and food, highly recommend!

xQllQ76TgIExWW2MC4zBIQ.text: Three out of five stars...  The food was excellent but the service was shitty, we walked in and the menu was backwards from the door. But what got me was all the kids working didn't do a damn thing to sell the amazing food in front of them. I felt as though I was an inconvenience to them, when all I wanted was to eat. I will try it again... I just hope the enthusiasm of the staff increases, because this place has the ability to be great!

gdecSNyTi5JKXgDugvqzKg.text: Ummmm, YUUUUM. Like, drooling yum. And dangit, this is a dangerous location. Right next to the frys I go to at least once a week. Im in trouble. SO good. Went here for the first time this past weekend, did the chicken sandwich with sides of potato salad and baked beans. I apparently missed the memo that the mac and cheese is to die for, so now I must return just for that! Not the cheapest, but I suppose same price range as somewhere such as chipotle. Not fast food, but not a full on site down fancy restaurant. Meat was very good. Wasn't a huge fan of the potato salad, not sure what it was about it. Not terrible, but will not get it again. Cute decor, friendly staff, and a little too good of a location. I shall return.

yUziu5AtlXR00bZAFs8Fzw.text: highlights:  1. the meat was really well cooked. we had pulled pork and the brisket. both were tender. moist. smokey. (not a bbq salt lick) 2. the sides were great. the beans were flavorful. the rice was soft and the coleslaw was cold and not overly dressed.  3. the staff was awesome! we went in at 8:45 (they close at 9) and received friendly service and good attitudes.  4. THIS IS FAST FOOD AND FAST SERVICE! having a good quality bbq meal fast and delicious requires a good review.   would we go back? HECK YAH! it's the only close bbq joint in town that ACTUALLY tastes like great bbq.

P5EVC6K5VqUOUUkwj-YXKw.text: Decent BBQ place. Interesting concept as you can order your meat in a burrito, bowl, etc.

16EBHqJlbptJSdoIKt6qfg.text: The food was delicious and the portions were great!  I got the pulled pork sandwich with a side of macaroni salad and sweet potato fries. The buns were soft and fluffy, and there was a generous amount of pork. My brother said the beef brisket was really good. My dad got the burrito and it was huge.  All the sauces for your meats are at each table. Our table had the zippy mustard, smoky & tangy BBQ, and mild & sweet BBQ,  My brother's and my favorite was the zippy mustard; I also liked the sweet & mild BBQ.  Note: they put the fries in the fryer after you order them so if you're super hungry and/or in a rush, you should avoid the fries. My dad had to wait a few mins for his waffle fries, and I waited quite a bit for my sweet potato fries (and a few still weren't fully cooked).  Verdict: will definitely be back!!
